title: How to Build a Blair Latrine

steps.headline: Select a suitable site that is at least 30 meters (98.4 ft) from wells or bore holes.
steps.description: This will help to ensure that human waste doesn't end up in the water supply.

steps.headline: Dig a pit in the ground.
steps.description: Make the pit 1.3 meters (4.3 ft) wide and 3 meters (9.8 ft) deep.

steps.headline: Line the pit around with bricks.
steps.description: Mortar the bricks in place with cement. Use a trowel to neaten the mortar and remove excess mortar.

steps.headline: Cover the completed brick pit with a round cement slab the same diameter as the hole (1.3 metres wide).The slab needs to have one hole for ventilation via a chimney and another hole to squat over.
steps.description: Cut these out before sealing the slab in place.

steps.headline: Seal the gap between the slab and the pit well.
steps.description: Use cement mortar again. Sealing it is vital because it will trap any flies and prevent them from congregating.

steps.headline: Build brick walls around the toilet base.
Attach a chimney to the ventilation hole and bring it up through the roof of the toilet.
steps.description: This ensures that dangerous odors and gases are ventilated upward and out into the air away from ground level.Place fly screen material over the top of the chimney.

steps.headline: Plaster the outer walls and chimney with adobe.
